dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just leave when you had the film? That’s worth way more than some bag of money. Dock considers.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: I did time for that money. My brother died for that money. That money’s mine.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: That money’s ours.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: That money’s ours.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Why’s that filmstrip worth so much anyway? That guy’s dead. Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Well, Boots... sometimes, the memory of a man matters more than the man himself. Ain’t that right, padre?

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: If you say so. Billy Lee drums his fingers. Thinks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 113.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna come looking for this money?

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Somebody's always looking for money.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: They’re all gone. ‘Cept me.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: And who are you again? Let’s say I want to check this story out... who am I looking for? What’s your real name, father?

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: (nods ) It’s... And Dock’s face goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (searches) It’s, um... Dock almost laughs at the absurdity. He can't remember hi own name. But then we see real fear in his eyes, just lik we saw in the prison. Just like we saw when we first met him, standing in the parking lot. He can’t remember. He looks to Miles.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hang on) It’s... Billy Lee rolls his eyes. Dock looks to Darlene. Almost pleading.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I tell you my real name? Darlene looks at Dock with sympathetic eyes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 72 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 114.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: You never did.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Really? Now you want to start playing games again?

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: He can’t remember. His mind -- it ain’t all there no more.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: That’s what he told you.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: And you believe anything this old crook says.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: I believe that much. Yeah. Billy Lee stares at both of them. Fed up with all of this

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Well then. Let’s see if we can’t jog his memory. (then) Darlene. Pick a color. BOOM. Right then, a violent CLAP of thunder shakes the hotel. And_all the power goes out in the room. 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone jumps in surprise. Dock and Darlene realize, too late, they missed a chance. But Annabell and Wade still have guns trained at their he Billy Lee holds up his hands. Take it easy, take it easy. Everything QUIET. The jukebox silent. Billy Lee starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Oof. That's right unsettling. The only light comes from the firepits around the room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 115.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shivers) It’s quiet again.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: I don’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: No, I don’t like it either. (thinks ) Ain’t you supposed to be a singer? Why don’t you sing something for us, then, Darlene? Darlene’s eyes go cold. She stares at Billy Lee. After a moment, she shakes her head. Billy Lee Billy Lee

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: No thank you. smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Tell you what. You sing something for us. And if you're as good as you say, I won’t make you play the game.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Don’t do it. (then) He’s gonna do what he’s gonna do. But he don’t deserve to hear you sing.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: No. He does not. stares at both of them. Unable to mask his anger at Dock’s words. Billy Lee Billy Lee

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Suit your fuckin’ selves. spins the roulette ball.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Wait. catches the roulette ball. Everything goes silent. Everyone stares at Darlene. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 116.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HOLD ON DARLENE. As she looks at these people around her. These felons, these criminals, these children. All of the She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh... My love... Her body relaxes. As though she’s no longer here in this dead-end border hotel. Her words come out quiet, never we

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My darling, I've... hungered for your touch... Everyone dead still as she sings. The firelight casting orange flickering shadows on their faces as they watch.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A long, lonely time. Her voice grows LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And time... goes by, so slowly.... And time, can do so much... (belting it out now) Are you, still --

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: I’ve heard better. He spins the roulette ball. Dock's eyes go blood simple. 73 WHAM! Dock explodes out of his seat, shattering his chair He slams his forehead right into Billy Lee’s face. Blood SPLATTERS as Billy Lee’s nose SHATTERS -- Billy Lee and D topple backwards -- And a bunch of things happen ALL AT ONCE: -- Dock and Billy Lee crash right into one of the firepit sending fire and embers and flaming logs everywhere. -- Annabell, surprised by the violence, FIRES HER SHOTGUN BOOM! The sound rips through the room, the buck shot cutt through the air where Dock just was, blasting flames and shredding furniture. -- Darlene, moving on terror and instinct, kicks herself backwards, away from the table. The table FLIPS -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 74 75 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 117.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- Everyone hits the ground in a mess of CASH, CHIPS, WHISKEY, and GLASS. Dock lands right on top of Billy Lee. Billy Lee’s gun goes skittering across the floor. And stops right between Darlene and Miles. Annabell raises her shotgun again. Pulls the trigger. But Rose grabs the barrel at the last second.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: wo! BOOM. The shot cuts the room. Blows another brazier into fireball.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll hit Billy Lee! Dock and Billy Lee tear into each other on the ground. 74 Violent and feral -- two men desperately trying to kill e other. Billy Lee bashes Dock -- Dock grabs a FLAMING LOG WHAM! He bashes Billy Lee in the face again and AGAIN -- ashes and FLAMES spread -- Rose SCREAMS. She dives at Dock. Tackles him off of Billy Lee. Annabell and Wade can’t get clean shots. FLAMES leap throughout the lobby, burning the rugs, the couches, the walls. ON THE GROUND: Darlene looks at the gun. Just feet from h But her hands are tied behind her back. She looks Miles i the eyes. He can grab it.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Miles -- But Miles is terrified. No longer fully with us anymore. Rocking back and forth on the ground. Crying. We start to hear what he’s been muttering this entire time:

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I can't I swore to God I can't kill no more people --

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Miles, HELP US --

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I_can't kill no more people. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 118.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And Darlene finally realizes what he’s saying. Wait. What Her words come out almost as a reflex:

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: H-how many people have you killed, Miles? CLOSE ON MILES as he thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: One-hundred and twenty-three. CUT TO BLACK. TITLE: Maintenance Closet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME FRAMING. Eight-year-old MILES MILLER raises a rifle. He takes his time, sites the rifle... CRACK. Whump. Widen to reveal Miles is standing on his family farm. They're having some sort of family gathering. Brothers an sisters, aunts and uncles all eating food, drinking moonshine, having a day. But everyone’s watching Miles. CRACK. Whump. This little eight-year-old boy is shooting sparrows out o the air while they're in flight with a rifle. Miles’ AUNTIE RUTH stands next to his momma, GINGER.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE RUTH
dialogues.text: Ho my heavens, Ginger! Look what your boy can do. If you’re not careful, you’re gonna have an army sniper in the family.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER
dialogues.text: Over my dead body. Daddy’d roll in his grave if I let Miles join the Army. No sir... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 77 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 119.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON MILES. Firing his rifle. We can see Ruth and Ginger in the background.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That boy is a Marine if there ever was one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME FRAMING. Miles, now grown, fires his sniper rifle as fast as he can as the cacophony of war rings out all arou him. Two SOLDIERS stand in the frame where Auntie Ruth an Ginger stood. They look up at the sound of --

dialogues.speaker: INCOMING
dialogues.text: BOOM. The soldiers are obliterated. Miles is blasted down the hill. The blood of his company all over him. We're in Khe Sanh, January, 1968. One of the bloodiest battles of the entire war. All around us: bullets fly, artillery explodes, men scream. SERGEANT RENFRO races forward. Yanks Miles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT RENFRO
dialogues.text: Miller! Why the fuck have you stopped shooting! ? Miles’ head is ringing. He’s clearly in shock. Terrified. As he stares at the war around him --

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I can't -- I can't do it no more --

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT RENFRO
dialogues.text: Get back on your fucking post! We don't hold this line, WE ALL DIE! (then)

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Miles shakes his head. He’s gone. Clearly in shock. Renfr stares at him. Genuine compassion in his eyes. SERGEANT RENFRO (CONT’D) Miles. (then) Miles. I don’t want to die here. I don’t want to die here on this hill tonight. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 78 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 120.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SERGEANT RENFRO (CONT’D) (then) I want to go home. Miles stares at Renfro. Hearing him. SERGEANT RENFRO (CONT’D) Do you want to go home? Miles stares at the violence all around him. He nods. SERGEANT RENFRO (CONT’D) Good. Sergeant Renfro thrusts the rifle back in Miles’ hands. SERGEANT RENFRO (CONT’D) Now shoot every fucking thing that moves. Miles nods. He raises his rifle once again. CRACK. Whump. CRACK. Whump. ANGLE IN ON MILES. Crack. Whump. Settling close on HIS EYES. Crack. Whump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME FRAMING. Miles’ eyes SNAP OPEN. He gasps for air. As though awakening from a horrible nightmare. WIDEN. It’s three days later. Miles is half-buried in the jungle. A mess of ruined bunker and debris all around him It's day now. It’s clear. It’s quiet. Miles pulls himself from his shallow grave. He steps out of the clearing. His face blank. Deep in shock. The walking dead. He face doesn’t react to what he’s seeing. We angle aroun to reveal: The aftermath of The Bloody Battle of Khe Sanh. Dead bodies EVERYWHERE. Hundreds... no... thousands... No Vietnamese and U.S. Solders, all around. All half-buried the sordid muck of Vietnam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 79 80 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 121.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miles walks through the carnage. His hands start shaking. He drops to his knees. He begins to pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME FRAMING. ON MILES. Shaking his head. Near-catatonic.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I can't do it... I swore to God... I can't kill no more people... I can't... ON DARLENE. Watching Miles. And, yes, there’s no real way she can know what he’s done, but she can see enough in hi face. She can see he’s in agony. She can see he’s lost. Her face softens. Genuine compassion in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: It’s all right, Miles. You don’t have to kill no more people. Those words seem to get through to Miles. Darlene closes eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't want to die. Please don't let me die here, Lord. Miles looks at her. ACROSS THE ROOM: Wade CRACKS Dock across the back of the with the rifle. Dock goes limp. Billy Lee skitters free. Wade and Annabell pummel Dock. AROUND THEM: smoke and fire fill the room. Billy Lee struggles to his feet. His nose destroyed. His face covered in blood. Fury in his eyes. Billy Lee grabs Annabell’s shotgun from the floor. Finds loose shells. Reloads it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE
dialogues.text: Get him up. Wade and Annabell yank Dock to his feet. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 122.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dock’s face is beat up pretty good. But he’s alert. His eyes still register when Billy Lee takes the shotgun and sticks it right up under Dock’s chin.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See if you can’t remember this. Click. Billy Lee freezes as he hears the unmistakable sound of a revolver being cocked behind him. Everyone turns. To find Miles. On his feet. Pointing the gun right at Bil Lee. Billy Lee holds his hand up. Calm down...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY LEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it easy, alter-bo-- CRACK. Miles shoots Billy Lee right between the eyes. Rose lets out a horrific, primal scream.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: NoOOO0O00! Wade swings his rifle, Annabell reaches for Billy Lee’s shotgun... CRACK CRACK. Two shots. On the move. Miles drills them both right between the eyes. Whump whump. Rose cradles Billy Lee’s body in her arms. Screaming.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No BILLY LEE no! Miles keeps moving. We see the soldier now. He checks the load on the revolver. One bullet left. He grabs the hunti knife off the floor. Hands Dock the revolver. Keeps movin Miles kicks Wade’s rifle up to himself. Catches it ina smooth motion. Dives towards the front window. CRASH! He breaks the front window with the butt of his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Flicker and Roman? They had just finished loadin Dwight’s body into the trunk when they heard the commotio (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 123.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And now they're frozen in the parking lot. Crouched behin cars. Holding their guns. They peek their heads up, trying to get a sightline to th front window. Trying to figure out what the hell's going in that lobby. Flicker and Roman lock eyes. Ready to move. Flicker peeks over the car. CRACK. Flicker’s head explodes. Roman jumps in surprise. CRACK. Roman takes it right between the eyes. Whump. Whump. Two down.

dialogues.speaker: INT LOUNGE
dialogues.text: Dock cuts Darlene free, helps to her feet. She rubs her wrists. They look towards -- ROSE. Screaming and crying on the ground. Rocking Billy Lee’s dead body in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: No no no no no... don't leave me, Billy Lee, don't leave me... Miles listens to her cries. The soldier falls away. The innocent boy returns. He drops his rifle. Walks over to her. Puts his hand on h shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m so sorry. Rose’s eyes narrow. She pulls THE KNIFE out of Billy Lee’ belt. SHRACK. She cuts Miles’ stomach open. Miles pitches backwards. Whump. His body lands right on t border between California and Nevada.

dialogues.speaker: NO --
dialogues.text: BANG. Dock shoots Rose in the chest with the revolver. Sh slumps dead. Still entangled in California with Billy Lee  83 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 124. ON THE GROUND. Miles gasps. Looks at his hands. Blood 83 everywhere. Oh god. Darlene races to him. Holds this terrified boy.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: No no no no -- I can’t die. I don’t want to die... not yet -- Darlene looks at Miles wound. Sees how bad it is. Looks t Dock for help. Dock’'s frozen. Flames starting to burn all around him. MILES (CONT’D) No no Lord please no I can't die not like this --

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Help him. Dock steps across the line into Nevada. Kneels down next them. Sees the bad news for himself. There's nothing to b done...

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Please God I don't want to die not yet -- Darlene grabs Dock’s shoulder. Looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Help him. CLOSE ON DOCK. As he realizes what she’s saying. As clari washes over him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: (quietly) Confess. He takes Miles in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My son. Confess. Miles stares up at Dock. Confused. Dying. He shakes his head. Blood coughing from his lips. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 Bad Times At The El Royale

dialogues.speaker: ON MILES.
dialogues.text: over him. Dock holds ON DOCK.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Final Shooting Draft 125. 83 You're not... You're not a...

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Miles Miller. My name is Father Daniel Flynn. And I am here to absolve you of your sins. As he stares at Dock.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: A calm starting to wash Bless me, Father, for I have sinned... him. Nods. Continue. MILES (CONT’D) I’ve sinned, I’ve sinned more times than I can count. I’ve killed, I've killed so many people... in war, here, I know it was wrong they told me to do it and I know it was wrong and I did it anyway... I’m so sorry, Father...

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: It’s all right.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: It’s not. I did so much bad. I lied. I stole. I hurt people. I killed people. I did it all even though I know it was wrong... I’m so sorry, Father... Staring at this terrified boy in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Do you seek absolution for your sins?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Ido. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Do you give yourself to the mercy of the Lord?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 84 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 126.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Will you give to Him the time you have left?

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: I’m too late.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: It is never too late, my son.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: Yes. I will try. I will try to be better. I will try to be a better man. (then) I repent. Father Flynn, I repent. (coughs blood) Lord, I’m sorry. I’m so sorry. Dock takes his hand, places it on Miles’ chest. Holds his gaze. Shh.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: You are forgiven. Miles begins to relax as soon as he hears those words.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Miles Miller. In the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit... you are forgiven. Miles nods. His eyes drift to the middle distance. At peace, finally. He dies in Dock’s arms. A moment. Dock and Darlene share a look. Dock lays Miles’ body down gently to the ground. Darlene closes his eyes. Dock and Darlene stand. 84 They look around. The flames are now crawling the walls. Smoke billows through the room. They glance at each other A silent agreement. They spring to action. They both scoop up what cash they can. They stuff it into the red bag. Time to go. As they’re leaving, Dock sees THE FILM CAN. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 127.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He picks it up. Thinks. Hands it to Darlene. She stares at it for a moment. Then she throws it into the fire. WHUMP. We’re CLOSE on the film reel as it burns and twist and smokes in the heat. Somebody tosses THE LEDGER PAGE on top of it as well. We the names, underlit by the flames: Laramie Seymour Sullivan... Fuck You... Darlene Sweet... Father Daniel Flynn... Dock and Darlene head for the door. HOLD ON THE PAPER. The names burst into flame. WIDE ON THE ROOM. As flames devour the El Royale, Dock op the Nevada door for Darlene. We see the first rays of daw on the horizon. Ring-ring. CUT TO BLACK. TITLE: Reno 85 OVER BLACK, we hear the sounds of a not-so-bustling keno parlor. People talking, slot machines ringing... We hear the voice of MILTON WYRICK, our emcee for the evening...

dialogues.speaker: MILTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Folks, I feel like we’ve got a genuine Humdinger Jackpot in here tonight, I really do... TITLE: Humdinger Lounge MILTON (0.S.) (CONT’D) Last time I felt this way, we gave away a brand new, candy-apple red Chrysler De Soto to a lovely couple from St. Paul, Minnesota. TITLE: 6 p.m. shift (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 128.

dialogues.speaker: MILTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bill and Elaine... McIntyre, I want to say. Good people. Could be you. Here we go... TITLE: Wednesday

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're FOLLOWING A MAN as he walks through the Humdinger Lounge, Reno’s sixth-best combination dinner lounge and k parlor. We hear the sound of the emcee calling to us from another room: MILTON (0.S.) (CONT’D) Seven, nine, sixteen, thirty-one, forty-two, forty-seven, sixty- three, seventy-six, and... eighty. The man makes his way through the smoke-filled rows of pe playing slots. He’s heading towards the back lounge, wher group of musicians are setting up on a small corner stage The man stops at the threshold. He rubs his hands on his pants. As though he’s not quite sure what to do. He looks for a seat in the lounge. (There are plenty available.)

dialogues.speaker: MILTON, (ONSTAGE)
dialogues.text: If you hit, come see the cashier so we can get you down before the next draw. The man sits down. We see his face. It’s Dock.

dialogues.speaker: MILTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, we've got a special treat for you tonight. Coming to you all the way from beautiful Los Angeles, California. You’ve heard her sing on records with artists such as The Crystals, Martha Reeves, The Marvelettes, Wilson Pickett, and The Miracles. Ladies and gentlemen, let’s give a warm, Reno welcome to... Darlene Sweet! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 Bad Times At The El Royale Final Shooting Draft 129.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Darlene steps on stage to a scattering of applause. We ma notice she has a brand new dress. She nods hello to her band for the evening. Hi boys. She looks to the audience.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE
dialogues.text: Thank y’all for coming out to listen to me tonight. A moment. As she stands in the light. Grateful for her life.

dialogues.speaker: DARLENE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It means the world. She sees Dock. Sitting alone in the back of the room. She almost seems surprised to see him. It’s you. He nods hello. She smiles. Hello, Dock. Then. Back to business. Two, three, four... Darlene grabs the microphone. CUT TO BLACK. The End OVER CREDITS: Darlene Sweet and her backup band level the p.m. Wednesday crowd at the Humdinger Lounge with an absolutely blistering cover of Sam & Dave’s “Hold On, I’m Coming.” Don't you ever be sad... Lean on me, when times are bad... Just hold on. I'm coming.
